name: effeminacy
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of behaving, looking like, or having qualities similar to a woman: Interest in clothes was taken as a sign of effeminacy. The "effeminacy" attributed to her work is not the sign of her own gender, but of a cultural taste. See
effeminate
More examplesFewer examplesWe reject the idea that there is effeminacy in caring about the way you look.He helped lift the long taboo against ostentation and effeminacy in male dress. He seemed to have an issue with the other man's effeminacy.
